attributes.action: Produce statutory guidance on how universities should support Dyslexic students.
attributes.background: Dyslexics learn differently. They are put at a disadvantage in today's educational system. Dyslexics should be given the same opportunity to reach their potential.
attributes.additional_details: I am dyslexic. I was lucky enough to receive a lot of support throughout my education. However, when I started university, my dyslexia became more apparent. I found it very difficult to learn from the teaching style. Moreover, the majority of my work was not marked in conjunction with my SPLD cover note. After speaking to my dyslexia help tutor, I learned that many lecturers do not believe in dyslexia. Therefore, the government should introduce statutory guidance to universities on how they can support dyslexic students. For example, by recommending compulsory seminars/training for staff.

attributes.action: Change the law on selling houses in the UK, in favour of protecting the vendors.
attributes.background:
Protect vendors from incomplete sales & costs being incurred. 
Although close to my heart, I am confident this is a UK wide issue & I propose we
introduce deposits, or purchasers accountability/liability, to protect & pay (for example) vendor solicitor fees. 
Make house selling/buying achievable.
attributes.additional_details:
Twice our house sale has fallen through and fees have been incurred due to the buyers ‘change of circumstance’. In these instances or similar, such fees should not be the responsibility of the vendor.

When you wish to buy a house, you should be committed to buying that house and as such (and similar to other countries) deposits should be paid. Additionally, any vendor solicitor fees (or any other costs) where buyers renage on their decision, should be solely the purchasers accountability.

attributes.action: Reduce 20% VAT on bottled water to zero in line with proposed sugar tax
attributes.background: With obesity reaching epidemic levels, how can it make sense to tax something healthy like bottled water while cake is zero rated for VAT ?
attributes.additional_details: Replace the reduction in VAT on bottled water by taxing cake instead

attributes.action: End the right of Anglican Bishops to have 26 seats in the House of Lords.
attributes.background: Although only 15% British citizens are practising Anglicans, and this falls to 3% for those under 24. This is a continuing trend, yet the UK parliament allows 26 unelected Anglican Bishops to sit in the House of Lords. This privileged, undemocratic, discriminatory, anachronism cannot continue.
attributes.additional_details: The right of Church of England Bishops to sit in the House of Lords is a tradition that continues from mediaeval times. The UK is the only parliament in the world that accords a unique privileged status to religious representatives. Known as 'Lords Spiritual' these 26 Church of England Bishops occupy a position of political power that is no longer relevant in a country where so few identify with the Anglican church. If Bishops wish to represent UK people, why should they not stand for election?

attributes.action: Expedite legislation guaranteeing the right to vote for UK citizens for life.
attributes.background: UK citizens residing outside the UK lose the right to vote in UK elections and referenda after 15 years as an overseas elector. The government had said it would introduce legislation to change this, giving the right to vote for life. That legislation should be introduced within the next 6 months.

attributes.action: Stop bank debit/credit card fees on letting agents who take money for clients
attributes.background: The credit/debit card fee ban starts 13 January - banks still charge a fee for card use. Banks make £billions yet small letting agents regularly receive money on behalf of clients and will now lose  money by just receiving client money.  It will impact tenants as companies will not accept cards.

attributes.action: Change the law to make it compulsory for all taxis to be fitted with CCTV
attributes.background: Shops, bars, hospitals, and the majority of public places are fitted with CCTV to maintain public safety.  Introducing cameras into taxis would promote the safety of both the general public and the driver, and decrease the risk of assault, abuse and theft.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics from the Metropolitan Police Service have revealed 126 taxi or private hire drivers were charged with violent or sexual offences in 2015. Furthermore 6 separate councils in the North West of England have granted or renewed permits for more than 300 convicted drivers since 2012. Within these approvals are those committed of sexual offences, indecent exposure, drug dealing, violence and harassment, possession of a fire arm, theft, burglary and criminal damage. This figures show that there needs to be further restrictions, and increased monitoring in place. 
 
The privacy of both parties would still be maintained, as conversations would not be recorded, and devices could be deactivated when the driver is not working.

attributes.action: Change the universal credit system to stop people suffering
attributes.background: Stop the non payment of universal credit if wages are paid early due to weekends and bank holidays
attributes.additional_details: People are suffering because they cannot afford to live under the universal credit system it is a disgrace.

attributes.action: Allow all the proceeds of ‘right to buy’ sales to be kept by the local authority
attributes.background: When right to buy council houses are sold there is no benefit to the local authority. If all proceeds of a right to buy sale were kept by the local authority the business case for new council housing is strong. Councils would build, the homeless would be housed, and funds earned for local councils.
attributes.additional_details:
When right to buy council houses are sold only a fraction of the price ever went to the local authority. This put an end to the building of new council housing. There is a clear local authority business case for building council housing: income generated will more than cover the costs, increasing revenues and reducing the need for cuts in other services. But the high chance that the tenant buys and all revenues go to central government destroys the business case.
See https://philhemsley.wordpress.com/2018/01/06/the-simple-change-to-government-budgeting-rules-that-could-solve-the-housing-problem/

attributes.action: Introduce fairer funding for schools in Yorkshire via a ‘Yorkshire Challenge’
attributes.background: In 2016 an IPPR study found that northern secondary schools received over £1,300 less per pupil than their London equivalent and primary schools suffer a £900 per pupil gap. At the time of releasing the figures IPPR North called upon the Government to address this via a ‘Powerhouse premium’.
attributes.additional_details: The turn around in London academic achievement since the ‘London Challenge’ has driven the number of pupils in the capital with five GCSE A to C grades to over 60%. It can be argued that a premium investment is made into London due to higher living costs but the IPPR North study found this to be not the case, in fact it found that northern schools should receive compensation for having a harder job than those in London. It is time for Yorkshire to have a ‘Yorkshire Challenge’ and fair funding.

attributes.action: Force developers to complete housing sites enabling timely adoption
attributes.background: Introduce legislation giving local authorities comprehensive powers enabling them to force Housing Developers to complete new developments, with particular reference to road surfacing and completion of landscaping and adoption of shared open spaces, before they are able to start new projects.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a national problem affecting all areas, which local authorities clearly do not have the necessary powers to resolve.

Discussion with our own County Council leader reveals that they have very limited powers to force developers to complete sites enabling their adoption in a timely manner.

attributes.action: Return power over admissions to academy schools to local authorities
attributes.background: Currently UK academy schools are not bound by local authorities’ admissions decisions. They are regulated by the Education and Skills Funding Agency, which is slow to respond to local authorities’ issues with academy schools.
attributes.additional_details: We’d like to see changes to the rules of legislation requiring academy schools to be bound to local education authorities and not be able to ignore rules they do not want to adhere to. We’d also like all public schools admissions authorities decisions to admit a child to a school to be final and binding. Academy schools are only bound by decisions made solely by the Secretary of State for Education. This is a situation that allows schools to completely ignore local schools authorities and this must change.

attributes.action: Fund bus passes for 16 to 18 years olds who are still in full time education
attributes.background: Why does the government insists that our children stay in education until they are 18 but will not fund the transportation to get to sixth form or college after they leave school at 16.

attributes.action: Police required by law to pursue suspects not wearing a helmet
attributes.background: Every day there is more and more crime on motorbikes/mopeds etc. If the people riding them aren’t wearing a helmet, they know that the police cannot pursue them. They are laughing and getting away with it. Enough is enough. If they're big enough to do the crime, they're big enough to take the risk.

attributes.action: That the government immediately and without strings give the NHS £10 Billion.
attributes.background: As a previous Dr it is obvious the "Winter Crisis" in the NHS is due directly to chronic under funding. Patients wait in A&E because of a lack of beds which have constantly reduced in number; not because of inappropriate attendances etc. Frontline NHS services need a direct increase in funding now!
attributes.additional_details: There are so many health professionals coming forward to argue this issue that no further references are really needed!

attributes.action: If Brexit negotiations indicate there will be no deal, hold a second referendum
attributes.background:
Recent reports of the progress made in Brexit negotiations are not positive, which is bad news to many leave and remain voters.

A second referendum is not undemocratic: the country can listen to voters whose opinions have changed and to those who are unhappy with the current execution of Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU referendum was won by a margin of less than 4%. Many participants voted based upon misinformation and false promises from the leave campaign.

Given the possibility that Britain could walk away from Brexit talks with no deal, it is undoubtedly democratic to give Britons the opportunity to reverse the last referendum, should no deal occur. A no-deal Brexit was not what the majority of leavers voted for, let alone remainers.

The referendum proposed here would be another simple in/out vote.

attributes.action: Theresa May. NO bridge or new infrastructure to be built between UK and France
attributes.background: We sadly have the channel tunnel which people can still walk through. We the public do not want anymore tax payers money being spent on infrastructure, that joins us to france.We're an island and want to keep it that way for OUR safety.
attributes.additional_details: Boris Johnson on Thursday January 18th 2018 said he wants to now build a bridge to join the uk to france

attributes.action: Impose a ban on unnessary plastic packaging being sold in supermarkets
attributes.background:
BP2 has highlighted how plastic is affecting our ecosystems with terrible consequences. 

Supermarkets are guilty of wrapping everything from avocado to apples in plastic which is rarely recyclable. 

Let’s demand that by law, less plastic packaging is used and what is HAS to be recyclable.
attributes.additional_details:
8 million tonnes of plastic is found in our oceans every year and marine life is paying the price.  

Plastic bags have been retrieved from the stomachs of multiple mammals including whales and albatross. Plastic forks have been found lodged in the noses of sea turtles and fish have been found growing around plastic pullrings and wrappers. 

It’s time the UK cleaned up its act and minimised our use of plastic before the damage is irreversible.

attributes.action: Make Armistice Day a national holiday starting 2018, 100 years since end of WW1.
attributes.background: Previous petitions have failed, but lets not give up.  The great war needs to live on in the hearts and minds of the next and all coming generations.  Additionally, there is no bank holiday between August and Christmas, and many workers feel the need for a break during this time.

attributes.action: Stop mortgage interest support benefit changes.
attributes.background:
Next April the mortgage interest benefits support change to become a loan. This will make life even more difficult for the claimants relying on this benefit.

It means that more people could lose their homes, in turn needing to find rental properties and claiming housing benefits.

attributes.action: Make Zebra crossings safer for Pedestrians
attributes.background:
My Dad, a 91 year old Father of 5 Children, 16 Grandchildren and 7 Great Grandchildren was knocked down and killed whilst crossing the Road at a Zebra Crossing. 

Govt should look at position/ suitability of crossings ensuring that a pedestrian crossing is the safest place for people to cross
attributes.additional_details:
At the Old Bailey, the Driver was acquitted of causing 'death by careless driving'. Emphasis was placed on our Dad not paying attention when crossing at the Zebra crossing rather than the Driver of the Car being careless. 

We feel:

Zebra Crossings on main Roads, near Schools and junctions be changed to Pelican Crossings

The Highway Code needs to be changed to give pedestrians greater priority at crossings

The distance of a crossing from a junction should be standardised to at least 8 metres

attributes.action: Abolish Inheritance Tax!
attributes.background:
We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again. 
We believe that the Government should be bold enough to act and axe this iniquitous tax.

attributes.action: Prohibit the release of pheasants into the countryside for shooting
attributes.background: Every year approximately 35,000,000 pheasants are released into the countryside to be shot for sport. They are often intensively reared and little able to cope in the wild, with many killed by cars.This non-native species also causes massive damage to crops and gardens. This practice needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Most pheasants in the UK have not reproduced in the wild but have been released. 25% of those bred in captivity die before the shooting season even begins. Many birds are wounded when shot and not killed outright. They are hugely destructive, causing damage costing thousands of pounds. On compassionate and environmental grounds, their release should be prohibited.
https://www.gwct.org.uk/research/species/birds/common-pheasant/
http://robyorke.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/gamebird-release.pdf

attributes.action: Make Puppy farming a criminal offence
attributes.background: A puppy farmer is a breeder who breeds puppies with little or no regard for the health and welfare of the puppies or their parents. Once the puppies are born, they are separated from their mothers at 4 weeks old. After, the bitches are given dangerous injections for them to go back into heat
attributes.additional_details:
Health of puppies sold by puppy farmers:
20% of puppies (four times more than the average) bought from pet shops or directly from the internet suffer from parvovirus, an often fatal disease which can cost up to £4,000 to treat (2014 Kennel Club PAW survey).

With no regulations, puppy mills have no cleanup control. This means that dogs can be living in urine and feces for indefinite periods of time.

Puppy mills have no veterinary care, climate control, or protection for the animals from weather

attributes.action: The breeding of puppies and kittens for profit by unlicensed breeders be banned.
attributes.background: Kelly's Kat Rescue has taken in over 150 cats and kittens in their small town and the surrounding areas since March all needing vet treatment and some in a life threatening condition. We need to prevent this from happening so we are calling for a licence to breed kittens and puppies.

attributes.action: UK Government to remove the race terms "Black" and "White" from its documents.
attributes.background: One of the earliest uses of black and white as metaphors for race was used in the 17th century when French Doctor François Bernier, an early proponent of scientific racism, divided up humanity based on facial appearance and body type.There were originally 4 colour groups, only black and white remain
attributes.additional_details:
They're opposites and ironically all race-related stereotypes associated with them are too. The connotations of these words compound positive and negative notions e.g. good, evil, weddings, funerals, white/black magic. The symbolic representations and emotions we identify with these words subconsciously effect us. 

This colour system assists in the paradigm of race hierarchy which has led to many irrational comparisons, historical/present animosity, privilege and discrimination amongst people. 

Every race is unique and has no opposite. Our race identity should be defined solely by our continents of origin (European/African/Asian etc), not colours. This reduces ignorance by connecting a person or group to countries, languages and cultures; qualities we love, share and have in common.

attributes.action: Ban gambling advertising in the UK.
attributes.background: I am 26 years old and I already know over ten people who have been near crippled by gambling addiction. The fact that gambling is advertised is disgusting and should be held in the same regard as other addictive substances which get abused by people with poor mental health.
attributes.additional_details: The adverts that we see on the television take advantage of people's weaknesses, use of apps in spare time, inability to be alone or bored and position gambling as a 'light-hearted', 'sociable' way of passing the time. The actual potential that gambling had to ruin people's lives and the lives of their families and friends is catastrophic. There needs to be more onus placed on centralised government's responsibility to stopping this happening.

attributes.action: Return the rail franchise to South West Trains (Stagecoach)
attributes.background:
Remove the franchise from First/MTR 
and return the franchise to South West Trains (stagecoach)
attributes.additional_details:
Since this franchise has been taken over by First/MTR passengers have expected soaring delays and cancellations across the whole of South Western network. 

Passengers are now expecting strike action. Due to the First/MTR wishing to scrap the guard on the train. 

South West Trains main purpose was too always have a second member of staff on board.

So by signing this petition you can help to bring South West Trains (stagecoach)  back & keep the second member of crew on board the service.

attributes.action: Ban prostitute review sites
attributes.background: There are sites where men review sex workers and their services. These sites are also a forum for online bullying, where they share personal details such as the real names of girls and their addresses, and nasty comments are all shared publicly for the world to see.

attributes.action: Update BE test rules to allow automatic cars to be used and gain manual as well
attributes.background: The BE driving licence rules need to be updated to allow people that take the test in an automatic to gain manual entitlement if they hold manual Cat B licence, as this is proving difficult for Trainers to buy suitable test vehicles, as more and more car manufacturers are stopping making manual cars
attributes.additional_details:
The rules were changed to allow Cat C and CE candidates to pass a test in an automatic truck and gain manual entitlement if they hold a manual Cat B licence, as more and more trucks were being made in automatic only.
This is now happening with car manufacturers and proving to be a problem to trainers in our industry.
Automatic vehicles are now more fuel efficient than manual vehicles so I feel the rules must be changed swiftly to enable us to help with reducing emissions to help our planet

attributes.action: Stop the cuts to mental health services in Gateshead and Newcastle.
attributes.background:
People are suffering poor mental health more and more and the most needy are being over looked.
Good mental health is as important as physical health and more cuts to north east mental health services will make more suffer.
May promised no cuts and she has gone back on that promise.

attributes.action: Scrap the variable speed limits as a traffic calming measure on the M25
attributes.background: I feel the variable speed limits cause unnecessary traffic on the motorway, cause accidents and add extra stress to daily driving on the motorway, I understand when there is an accident or incident on the motorway it is necessary  but used as a 'traffic calming' measure' doesn't work.
attributes.additional_details: 90% of the time driving on the m25 there is a 60mph 50 and 40 limit imposed where drives slow down under the gantry to around 30mph which causes drivers to brake and further down turns into stand still, once national speed limit is in place the traffic is clear. this is guaranteed in the same places, almost every day in peak hours.

attributes.action: Ban the production and use of plastic rings as packaging material
attributes.background: Plastic rings are currently being used to hold drinking cans together. Animals are getting caught up in the plastic rings and need to either live handicapped with them or die dreadfully. Single cans can be put into shopping bags. There is no need to harm animals and the environment.

attributes.action: Stop GP surgeries charging for medical letters for patients.
attributes.background: GP surgeries often ask for payment for providing medical letters to some of the most vulnerable patients. For many patients , being asked to pay up to £25 for a letter to prove their medical condition can lead to greater stress, anxiety, and a feeling of hopelessness. Medical letters must be free.

attributes.action: Introduce 19 baby check questions in to prenatal & postnatal information given
attributes.background: 19 baby check questions may help identify if a baby has Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) risk. Should be included in prenatal & postnatal information from midwifes & health visitor. You are given leaflet about enviromental factors. Check List only available from charity which supports after SIDS.
attributes.additional_details: Studies show 19 question scored checklist may determine which babies are at risk of SIDS. It is based on many symptoms & signs that are not significant individually, but taken together may signify a risk of death. The Baby Check as a means of quantifying acute illness, can be used by parents to help them decide whether to seek medical attention. It can be used by health professionals as a tool to discriminate between those babies who should be assessed in hospital and those who need not be.

attributes.action: Halt the scrapping of HMS OCEAN.
attributes.background: HMS Ocean is a very versatile and potent warship which this country needs to keep in service (or build a replacement). Its value is not only as an assault ship but as a humanitarian support vessel.

attributes.action: Legalise drugs
attributes.background: Drug laws are hypocritical with two of the most dangerous (alcohol and nicotine) being legal while far safer drugs carry a prison sentence and stigma for possession.
attributes.additional_details:
Criminalising drugs drives crime, encourages gangs and mean dangerous cuts are on the streets. Addicts are unsupported, driven to use stronger versions of their drugs and not knowing if it is cut with harmful chemicals. 
Legislation would allow drugs to be controlled,  user would know they are buying pure substances.  Strength can be controlled and help can be provided to curb addiction. Drug related crime and gangs will disappear overnight.  And tax revenues would easily cover the NHS fund gap

attributes.action: Regulate animal rescue centres.
attributes.background:
Animal rescue centres are currently not regulated. This means that anyone can open as a rescue centre.
 
Regulation would allow for rules and guidelines to be issued and regular visits made to inspect that there is at minimum no breach of the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Remove the "Henry VIII Powers" from the European Union (Withdrawal) Bill
attributes.background:
When 37.5% of the electorate (51.9% of those who voted) voted to bring back power the UK Parliament, it was not their intention to immediately hand over that power to the Theresa May and her Government.

We fought 2 Civil Wars in England to give Parliament the power to control what is UK law.
attributes.additional_details:
In it's current form the European Union (Withdrawal) Bill gives the Government the power to change UK law without Parliamentary scrutiny.

This power can be used safely, such as amendments to the breeds of dog in the Dangerous Dogs Act, however it has also been abused. In 2013 Chris Grayling MP attempted to introduce a residency test barrier to obtaining legal aid.

There is a lot more at stake here: Consumer Protection, Employment, Snoopers Charter, Environmental Protection, rights of Appeal.

attributes.action: Make 16-25 railcard useable before 10am. Senior Citizens can use theirs anytime.
attributes.background: Under the current National Rail Conditions, young people who invest in a rail card cannot use it before 10am. Meanwhile, Senior Citizens can use their railcard anytime. After exhaustive enquiries with National Rail Conditions, there has been no clear explanation as to why these restrictions exist.
attributes.additional_details: After contacting National Rail Conditions enquiries, I tried to establish some clarity. After being placed on hold numerous times, he said the reason behind the restriction was due to a minimum fare of £3.90 between 4:30am -10am. This 'reduced' fare is actually the standard price and is available to everybody including Senior Citizens. So it still offers no valid explanation for this inverted ageism. Please join me by signing this petition to ensure national companies work for all!

attributes.action: Hold a General Election if there is no deal on Brexit by September 2018
attributes.background: Leaving the EU without an agreement on our future relationship would be catastrophic in economic and human terms. If the government cannot deliver, our sovereign Parliament should be allowed to implement alternative arrangements, including dissolution and a General Election, to avoid this outcome.
attributes.additional_details: When people voted leave in the EU Referendum, there was no suggestion that we would choose to, or have to, leave without a deal. The government has not made any practical preparations for a no deal scenario, and  negotiations are not progressing fast enough. If the government cannot deliver, Parliament should take over and use whatever means necessary to avoid a no deal scenario. As this will involve a loss of confidence in the current government, a General Election should be held.

attributes.action: Maternity pay to reflect your regular salary.
attributes.background: Maternity pay is the same for everyone regardless of their usual earnings. A part time colleague took her full maternity leave as her pay was similar to her usual salary. I feel discriminated as a higher earner as I will need to return to work early as I will lose £1200 per month on maternity pay.

attributes.action: Undertake due diligence on Severn tolling to consider extending beyond end-2018
attributes.background: The abolition of the tolls will have serious economic consequences for the locality as resulting traffic growth impacts an already severely congested motorway network. A tolling extension will assist in the alleviation of congestion at little additional cost and aid WAG with relief road project time
attributes.additional_details: The M4 network in Wales is not equipped for the expected post-tolls traffic growth. Without the tolls ‘buffer’ any perceived financial boost to the economy will be effectively lost in the ensuing traffic chaos. The introduction of an extended tolling sliding scale regime (designed to collect 2018 tolls over 2018-2021) will have long lasting benefits. It will not compromise DfT debt recovery, end-users will not be financially disadvantaged, and it offers WAG a time extension for its relief scheme

attributes.action: Enforce a maximum limit on vehicle insurance prices for young people.
attributes.background: Insurance prices in this modern day are through the roof. And its even worse for young drivers. I know there is more of a chance of us crashing due to lack of experience however we still need to get to work and function as a part of society.
attributes.additional_details: My first year car insurance was £1600 on a Ford Ka. Paid in monthly instalments. Unfortunately I crashed in my first year due to a spillage on the road during a wet day. Unavoidable. I was following the speed limit, no one else was involved. But my insurance is due to rise to upwards of £3000 in January. I am 19 and well paid for my age but still this is going to be a struggle. I know many people who also struggle with this however first year drivers older than 24 pay less, how does that work?

attributes.action: Require schools to teach year five and above about LGBT and how it’s positive.
attributes.background: It is important that children know about gay and transgender people as someone they know could be gay/trans or some might be gay/trans themselves.
attributes.additional_details: I got lots of abuse when I came out as gay because the people I was around did not know much on the subject. I also know many people who experienced this kind of abuse.

attributes.action: Alter the definition of rape under English law to include assault by penetration
attributes.background: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 states that rape is where "[the rapist] intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person B with his penis" and "B does not consent". People who are raped using an object or fingers are said to have been 'assaulted by penetration' and not raped.
attributes.additional_details: Using 'assault by penetration' to legally describe this act of rape downplays the experiences of people who have suffered in this way, and could prevent them from getting the support they need from rape shelters and therapy. It could cause additional psychological harm by preventing them from coming to terms with what happened to them, since 'assault by penetration' does not have the same stigma as the word 'rape'. So-called 'assault by penetration' can also cause PTSD, as can rape and other forms of sexual assault. The definition is also too simplistic as it does not take into account lack of consent in LGBT+ interactions and relationships, and implies that only men can rape.

attributes.action: Equal pay for 16 to 21 year olds
attributes.background: People under 21 are paid less then people over 21 years old, even if they are doing the same job, but 16 year olds are allowed to get married, have kids and join the armed forces. From 18 you can drink in a pub and more importantly vote so why shouldn't you have equal pay?

attributes.action: Allow all children in school term times a leave allowance for family hoildays.
attributes.background:
I am unable to take leave in term times due to the loss of earnings being self employed and the inflated prices travel operators charge. This makes it impossible for normal working people to afford a family holiday. 
We ask for the government to discuss allowing at least 7 days a year for this.
attributes.additional_details: It is a known fact that during our childrens term times average holiday's increase by hundreds if not thousands. This has been an ongoing issue that the government have never really addressed to benefit parents. The impact on working class and self employed often means we are unable to have family hoilday's due to the inflated prices. Enabling a small amount of leave days per year, will benefit all children from a family point of view as well as a educational point of view. Thank you.

attributes.action: The Houses of Parliament should erect a monument to Daniel O'Connell
attributes.background: Daniel O'Connell, often known as The Liberator or The Great Emancipator, was an Irish political leader. He campaigned, successfully, for Catholic Emancipation in the first half of the 19th century.
attributes.additional_details: O'Connell played a leading role in achieving Catholic Emancipation - including the right for Catholics to sit in the Westminster Parliament - and the values of egalitarianism, tolerance and human rights, which he helped instil, continue to underpin modern democracy around the world. A leading MP from 1828-1841, his philosophy and career inspired diverse others from Mahatma Gandhi to Martin Luther King Jr. to Nelson Mandela. It is time for O'Connell to be recognised with a monument in Parliament.

attributes.action: Combine the digital tachograph with the driver CPC (DQC) card
attributes.background: Currently you need a 5yr digital tachograph card to record your actions and the driver CPC card to prove you have completed 35h training over 5 years if you don't have your CPC card you will be fined £50.00 if you are driving commercial vehicles you need to have both with you a legal requirement
attributes.additional_details: Having trained hundreds of drivers and spoken to hundreds of transport managers everyone agrees there should be an alignment of both cards you need both to work and a simple alignment so you cannot get a digital card without completing 35h training
